eliot_birth_country = "United States"

question: Which poet was born in the United States, W.H. Auden or T.S. Eliot?
doc_code:
# Wystan Hugh Auden (21 February 1907 – 29 September 1973) was an English-American poet.
w_h_auden_full_name = "Wystan Hugh Auden"
w_h_auden_birth_date = "21 February 1907"
w_h_auden_death_date = "29 September 1973"
w_h_auden_nationalities = ["English", "American"]
w_h_auden_profession = "poet"
# He was born in York, England, and later became a U.S. citizen in 1946.
w_h_auden_birthplace = "York, England"
w_h_auden_us_citizenship_year = 1946
# His poetry is noted for its stylistic and technical achievements.
w_h_auden_poetry_noted_for = ["stylistic achievements", "technical achievements"]
# Thomas Stearns Eliot (26 September 1888 – 4 January 1965) was an American-born poet, essayist, publisher, and playwright.
t_s_eliot_full_name = "Thomas Stearns Eliot"
t_s_eliot_birth_date = "26 September 1888"
t_s_eliot_death_date = "4 January 1965"
t_s_eliot_birthplace = "St. Louis, Missouri, United States"
t_s_eliot_professions = ["poet", "essayist", "publisher", "playwright"]
# He was born in St. Louis, Missouri, in the United States, and became a British citizen in 1927.
t_s_eliot_citizenship_change_year = 1927
t_s_eliot_citizenship = "British"
# He is considered one of the 20th century's major poets, known for works like 'The Waste Land' and 'Four Quartets'.
t_s_eliot_notable_works = ["The Waste Land", "Four Quartets"]
t_s_eliot_literary_status = "major poet of the 20th century"
# St. Louis is a city located in the state of Missouri in the United States.
st_louis_location = "Missouri, United States"
# It is known for its cultural history, including being the birthplace of the poet T. S. Eliot.
st_louis_known_for = ["cultural history", "birthplace of T. S. Eliot"]
# The Naturalization Act of 1946 allowed foreign-born residents in the United States to apply for citizenship under revised criteria.
naturalization_act_1946_description = "Allowed foreign-born residents in the US to apply for citizenship under revised criteria"
# W. H. Auden was among those who became a naturalized American citizen under this law.
naturalized_under_1946_act = ["W. H. Auden"]
# Modernist poetry is characterized by a break with traditional forms and an emphasis on experimentation.
modernist_poetry_characteristics = ["break with traditional forms", "experimentation"]
# Both T. S. Eliot and W. H. Auden are widely regarded as influential figures in this literary movement.
modernist_poets = ["T. S. Eliot", "W. H. Auden"]

question: What diplomatic position was held by the actress who portrayed the character Emily Webb in the film Our Town (1940)?
doc_code:
# Our Town is a 1940 American drama film adaptation of the Thornton Wilder play of the same name.
our_town_film_year = 1940
our_town_film_genre = "American drama"
our_town_source_play = "Our Town"  # by Thornton Wilder
# The film stars William Holden as George Gibbs and Martha Scott as Emily Webb.
our_town_cast = {{"George Gibbs": "William Holden", "Emily Webb": "Martha Scott"}}
# The screenplay was adapted by Harry Chandlee and Frank Craven, and the film was directed by Sam Wood.
our_town_screenwriters = ["Harry Chandlee", "Frank Craven"]
our_town_director = "Sam Wood"

# Martha Ellen Scott (September 22, 1912 – May 28, 2003) was an American actress best known for originating the role of Emily Webb in the original Broadway production of 'Our Town' and reprising the role in the 1940 film adaptation.
martha_scott_full_name = "Martha Ellen Scott"
martha_scott_birth_date = "September 22, 1912"
martha_scott_death_date = "May 28, 2003"
martha_scott_profession = "American actress"
martha_scott_known_for = ["originating Emily Webb on Broadway", "reprising Emily Webb in 1940 film"]
# Later in life, she became active in politics and diplomacy, and in 1977, she was appointed United States Ambassador to Czechoslovakia.
martha_scott_political_roles = ["United States Ambassador to Czechoslovakia"]
martha_scott_ambassador_appointment_year = 1977

# The United States Ambassador to Czechoslovakia was the official representative of the United States to the government of Czechoslovakia until the country split into the Czech Republic and Slovakia in 1993.
us_ambassador_czechoslovakia_role = "Official US representative to Czechoslovakia"
us_ambassador_czechoslovakia_existed_until = 1993
# Among its appointees have been both career diplomats and public figures from outside the foreign service.
us_ambassador_czechoslovakia_appointment_backgrounds = ["career diplomats", "public figures"]

# Thornton Wilder was an American playwright and novelist, known for writing 'Our Town', which premiered in 1938 and won the Pulitzer Prize for Drama.
thornton_wilder_profession = ["playwright", "novelist"]
thornton_wilder_known_for = ["writing 'Our Town'"]
our_town_play_premiere_year = 1938
our_town_pulitzer_prize = True
# The story of small-town life was later adapted into a 1940 film starring Martha Scott.
our_town_film_adaptation_star = "Martha Scott"

# The American Film Institute (AFI) is a non-profit organization dedicated to preserving the history of film and honoring artists within the industry.
afi_type = "non-profit organization"
afi_mission = ["preserve film history", "honor film artists"]
# AFI recognized Martha Scott for her dual contributions to American film and public service in its 1998 tribute series.
afi_1998_tribute_recipient = "Martha Scott"
afi_1998_recognition_reasons = ["American film", "public service"]
